analysis_age: The emphasis on "MUST HAVE proven and recent experience" could unintentionally limit the applicant pool to those who have had very specific recent roles, potentially excluding capable candidates who have relevant experience that isn't recent or is in a slightly different context. This may disadvantage older candidates.
analysis_general: May disadvantage those who have taken a career break (for reasons such as maternity/paternity leave, caring for family members, or health issues) and are looking to return to work.
text: Science Technician. Wirral. Academics are currently supporting an incredible community high school on the Wirral who are currently looking to appoint a Science Technician. The successful applicant MUST HAVE proven and recent experience of being a science technician within a school environment including experience of setting up for practical lessons and providing the Science department with technical support. Academics are recruiting for this role ASAP as the school are hoping to interview and appoint someone as soon as possible. This is a full-time role which will be on-going. The ideal science technician must have: Relevant and recent experience as a Science Technician. Excellent knowledge of a Science department and their needs. Have a pro-active attitude towards your role whilst also using you own initiative. Enhanced DBS check registered to the update service or be willing to get one. In return Academics can offer you: Excellent rates of pay. A specialist and dedicated consultant to support your throughout your role. An incredible opportunity to be a part of a well run school and department. FREE online CPD courses. REFER A FRIEND REWARD SCHEME DON'T MISS OUT ON THIS AMAZING LONG TERM OPPORTUNITY! APPLY TODAY or call Roxanne on (phone number removed) to discuss further.
